items.title: On Eccentric Protoplanetary Disks I -- How Eccentric are Planet-Perturbed Disks?
items.summary: arXiv:2602.16769v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Protoplanetary disks can become eccentric when planets open deep gaps within, but how eccentric are they? We answer this question by analyzing two-dimensional hydrodynamical simulations of planet-disk interaction. The steady state e…

items.title: A positive period derivative in the quasi-periodic eruptions of ZTF19acnskyy
items.summary: arXiv:2602.16776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We report the first direct measurement of the period derivative in a quasi-periodic eruption (QPE), finding a smoothly increasing period with $\dot{P}\approx (1.7\pm 0.02)\times10^{-2}$ d d$^{-1}$ in the source ZTF19acnskyy/"Ansky".…
